40namespace bm
41{
42
43/**
44 Basic dense bit-matrix class.
45
46 Container of row-major bit-vectors, forming a bit-matrix.
47 This class uses dense form of row storage.
48 It is applicable as a build block for other sparse containers and
49 succinct data structures, implementing high level abstractions.
50
51 @ingroup bmagic
52 @internal
53*/
54template<typename BV>
55class basic_bmatrix
56{
57public:
58 typedef BV bvector_type;
59 typedef bvector_type* bvector_type_ptr;
60 typedef const bvector_type* bvector_type_const_ptr;
61 typedef typename BV::allocator_type allocator_type;
62 typedef typename bvector_type::allocation_policy allocation_policy_type;
63 typedef typename allocator_type::allocator_pool_type allocator_pool_type;
64 typedef typename bvector_type::size_type size_type;
65 typedef typename bvector_type::block_idx_type block_idx_type;
66 typedef unsigned char octet_type;
67
68public:
69 // ------------------------------------------------------------
70 /*! @name Construction, assignment */
71 ///@{
72
73 basic_bmatrix(size_type rsize,
74 allocation_policy_type ap = allocation_policy_type(),
75 size_type bv_max_size = bm::id_max,
76 const allocator_type& alloc = allocator_type());
77 ~basic_bmatrix() BMNOEXCEPT;
78
79 /*! copy-ctor */
80 basic_bmatrix(const basic_bmatrix<BV>& bbm);
81 basic_bmatrix<BV>& operator=(const basic_bmatrix<BV>& bbm)
82 {
83 copy_from(bbm);
84 return *this;
85 }
86
87#ifndef BM_NO_CXX11
88 /*! move-ctor */
89 basic_bmatrix(basic_bmatrix<BV>&& bbm) BMNOEXCEPT;
90
91 /*! move assignmment operator */
92 basic_bmatrix<BV>& operator = (basic_bmatrix<BV>&& bbm) BMNOEXCEPT
93 {
94 if (this != &bbm)
95 {
96 free_rows();
97 swap(bbm);
98 }
99 return *this;
100 }
101
102#endif
103
104 void set_allocator_pool(allocator_pool_type* pool_ptr) BMNOEXCEPT
105 { pool_ = pool_ptr; }
106
107 ///@}
108
109 // ------------------------------------------------------------
110 /*! @name content manipulation */
111 ///@{
112
113 /*! Swap content */
114 void swap(basic_bmatrix<BV>& bbm) BMNOEXCEPT;
115
116 /*! Copy content */
117 void copy_from(const basic_bmatrix<BV>& bbm);
118
119 /*! Freeze content into read-only mode drop editing overhead */
120 void freeze();
121
122 ///@}
123
124 // ------------------------------------------------------------
125 /*! @name row access */
126 ///@{
127
128 /*! Get row bit-vector. Can return NULL */
129 const bvector_type* row(size_type i) const BMNOEXCEPT;
130
131 /*! Get row bit-vector. Can return NULL */
132 bvector_type_const_ptr get_row(size_type i) const BMNOEXCEPT;
133
134 /*! Get row bit-vector. Can return NULL */
135 bvector_type* get_row(size_type i) BMNOEXCEPT;
136
137 /*! get number of value rows */
138 size_type rows() const BMNOEXCEPT { return rsize_; }
139
140 /*! get number of value rows without (not) NULLs bvector */
141 size_type rows_not_null() const BMNOEXCEPT { return rsize_ - bool(null_idx_);}
142
143 /*! get number of assigned avlue rows without \ NULLs bvector */
144 size_type calc_effective_rows_not_null() const BMNOEXCEPT;
145
146
147 /*! Make sure row is constructed, return bit-vector */
148 bvector_type_ptr construct_row(size_type row);
149
150 /*! Make sure row is copy-constructed, return bit-vector */
151 bvector_type_ptr construct_row(size_type row, const bvector_type& bv);
152
153 /*! destruct/deallocate row */
154 void destruct_row(size_type row);
155
156 /*! clear row bit-vector */
157 void clear_row(size_type row, bool free_mem);
158
159 /** return index of the NULL vector */
160 size_type get_null_idx() const BMNOEXCEPT { return null_idx_; }
161
162 /** set index of the NULL vector */
163 void set_null_idx(size_type null_idx) BMNOEXCEPT;
164
165 /** allocate matrix rows of bit-vectors (new rows are NULLs) */
166 void allocate_rows(size_type rsize);
167
168 /** Free all rows */
169 void free_rows() BMNOEXCEPT;
170
171 ///@}
172
173
174 // ------------------------------------------------------------
175 /*! @name octet access and transposition */
176 ///@{
177
178 /*!
179 Bit-transpose an octet and assign it to a bit-matrix
180
181 @param pos - column position in the matrix
182 @param octet_idx - octet based row position (1 octet - 8 rows)
183 @param octet - value to assign
184 */
185 void set_octet(size_type pos, size_type octet_idx, unsigned char octet);
186
187 /*!
188 Bit-transpose and insert an octet and assign it to a bit-matrix
189
190 @param pos - column position in the matrix
191 @param octet_idx - octet based row position (1 octet - 8 rows)
192 @param octet - value to assign
193 */
194 void insert_octet(size_type pos, size_type octet_idx, unsigned char octet);
195
196 /*!
197 return octet from the matrix
198
199 @param pos - column position in the matrix
200 @param octet_idx - octet based row position (1 octet - 8 rows)
201 */
202 unsigned char get_octet(size_type pos, size_type octet_idx) const BMNOEXCEPT;
203
204 /*!
205 Compare vector[pos] with octet
206
207 It uses regulat comparison of chars to comply with the (signed)
208 char sort order.
209
210 @param pos - column position in the matrix
211 @param octet_idx - octet based row position (1 octet - 8 rows)
212 @param octet - octet value to compare
213
214 @return 0 - equal, -1 - less(vect[pos] < octet), 1 - greater
215 */
216 int compare_octet(size_type pos,
217 size_type octet_idx, char octet) const BMNOEXCEPT;
218
219 /*!
220 Return number of octet currently allocated rows in the matrix
221 */
222 size_type octet_size() const BMNOEXCEPT;
223
224 ///@}
225
226
227 // ------------------------------------------------------------
228 /*! @name Utility functions */
229 ///@{
230
231
232 /// Get low level internal access to
233 const bm::word_t* get_block(size_type p,
234 unsigned i, unsigned j) const BMNOEXCEPT;
235
236 /**
237 Clear bit-planes bit
238 @param slice_from - clear from [from, until)
239 @param slice_until - clear until (open interval!)
240 @param idx - bit index
241 */
242 void clear_slices_range(unsigned slice_from, unsigned slize_until,
243 size_type idx);
244
245 unsigned get_half_octet(size_type pos, size_type row_idx) const BMNOEXCEPT;
246
247 /*!
248 \brief run memory optimization for all bit-vector rows
249 \param temp_block - pre-allocated memory block to avoid re-allocs
250 \param opt_mode - requested compression depth
251 \param stat - memory allocation statistics after optimization
252 */
253 void optimize(
254 bm::word_t* temp_block = 0,
255 typename bvector_type::optmode opt_mode = bvector_type::opt_compress,
256 typename bvector_type::statistics* stat = 0);
257
258 /*! Optimize block in all planes
259 @internal
260 */
261 void optimize_block(block_idx_type nb);
262
263 /*! Compute memory statistics
264 @param st [out] - statistics object
265 @param rsize - row size (for cases when operation is limited not to touch the NULL bit-vector)
266 */
267 void calc_stat(typename bvector_type::statistics& st,
268 size_type rsize) const BMNOEXCEPT;
269
270 /*! Erase column/element
271 @param idx - index (of column) / element of bit-vectors to erase
272 @param erase_null - erase all including NULL vector (true)
273 */
274 void erase_column(size_type idx, bool erase_null);
275
276 /*! Insert value 0 into a range of rows
277 @param idx - index (of column) / element of bit-vectors to erase
278 @param row_from - row to start from
279 */
280 void insert_column(size_type idx, size_type row_from);
281
282 /*! Clear value (set 0) into a range of rows
283 @param idx - index (of column) / element of bit-vectors
284 @param row_from - row to start from
285 */
286 void clear_column(size_type idx, size_type row_from);
287
288 /**
289 Set SUB (MINUS) operation on all existing rows
290 @param bv - argument vector row[i] -= bv
291 @param use_null - if true clear the NULL vector as well
292 */
293 void bit_sub_rows(const bvector_type& bv, bool use_null);
294
295 /**
296 Set AND (intersect) operation on all existing rows
297 @param bv - argument vector row[i] &= bv
298 */
299 void bit_and_rows(const bvector_type& bv);
300
301
302 ///@}
303
304protected:
305
306 bvector_type* construct_bvector(const bvector_type* bv) const;
307 void destruct_bvector(bvector_type* bv) const;
308
309 static
310 void throw_bad_alloc() { BV::throw_bad_alloc(); }
311
312 template<typename Val, typename BVect, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
313 friend class base_sparse_vector;
314
315protected:
316 size_type bv_size_;
317 allocator_type alloc_;
318 allocation_policy_type ap_;
319 allocator_pool_type* pool_;
320
321 bvector_type_ptr* bv_rows_;
322 size_type rsize_;
323 size_type null_idx_; ///< Index of the NULL row
324};
325
326/**
327 Base class for bit-transposed(bit-sliced) sparse vector construction.
328 Keeps the basic housekeeping lements like matrix of sparse elements
329
330 @ingroup bmagic
331 @internal
332*/
333template<typename Val, typename BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
334class base_sparse_vector
335{
336public:
337 enum bit_planes
338 {
339 sv_slices = (sizeof(Val) * 8 * MAX_SIZE + 1),
340 sv_value_slices = (sizeof(Val) * 8 * MAX_SIZE)
341 };
342
343 enum vector_capacity
344 {
345 max_vector_size = MAX_SIZE
346 };
347
348 typedef Val value_type;
349 typedef BV bvector_type;
350 typedef typename BV::size_type size_type;
351 typedef bvector_type* bvector_type_ptr;
352 typedef const bvector_type* bvector_type_const_ptr;
353 typedef const value_type& const_reference;
354 typedef typename BV::allocator_type allocator_type;
355 typedef typename bvector_type::allocation_policy allocation_policy_type;
356 typedef typename bvector_type::enumerator bvector_enumerator_type;
357 typedef typename allocator_type::allocator_pool_type allocator_pool_type;
358 typedef bm::basic_bmatrix<BV> bmatrix_type;
359 typedef typename std::make_unsigned<value_type>::type unsigned_value_type;
360
361public:
362 base_sparse_vector();
363
364 base_sparse_vector(bm::null_support null_able,
365 allocation_policy_type ap,
366 size_type bv_max_size,
367 const allocator_type& alloc);
368
369 base_sparse_vector(const base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>& bsv);
370
371#ifndef BM_NO_CXX11
372 /*! move-ctor */
373 base_sparse_vector(base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>&& bsv) BMNOEXCEPT
374 {
375 bmatr_.swap(bsv.bmatr_);
376 size_ = bsv.size_;
377 effective_slices_ = bsv.effective_slices_;
378 bsv.size_ = 0;
379 }
380#endif
381
382 void swap(base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>& bsv) BMNOEXCEPT;
383
384 size_type size() const BMNOEXCEPT { return size_; }
385
386 void resize(size_type new_size, bool set_null);
387
388 void clear_range(size_type left, size_type right, bool set_null);
389
390 void keep_range_no_check(size_type left, size_type right,
391 bm::null_support slice_null);
392
393 /*! \brief resize to zero, free memory
394 @param free_mem - fully destroys the plane vectors if true
395 */
396 void clear_all(bool free_mem = true) BMNOEXCEPT;
397
398 /*! return true if empty */
399 bool empty() const BMNOEXCEPT { return size() == 0; }
400
401public:
402
403 // ------------------------------------------------------------
404 /*! @name Various traits */
405 ///@{
406 ///
407
408 /**
409 \brief returns true if value type is signed integral type
410 */
411 static constexpr bool is_signed() BMNOEXCEPT
412 { return std::is_signed<value_type>::value; }
413
414 /**
415 \brief check if container supports NULL(unassigned) values
416 */
417 bool is_nullable() const BMNOEXCEPT { return bmatr_.get_null_idx(); }
418
419 /**
420 \brief check if container supports NULL (unassigned) values
421 */
422 bm::null_support get_null_support() const BMNOEXCEPT
423 { return is_nullable() ? bm::use_null : bm::no_null; }
424
425 /**
426 \brief Get bit-vector of assigned values or NULL
427 (if not constructed that way)
428 */
429 const bvector_type* get_null_bvector() const BMNOEXCEPT
430 {
431 if (size_type null_idx = bmatr_.get_null_idx())
432 return bmatr_.get_row(null_idx);
433 return 0;
434 }
435
436 /** \brief test if specified element is NULL
437 \param idx - element index
438 \return true if it is NULL false if it was assigned or container
439 is not configured to support assignment flags
440 */
441 bool is_null(size_type idx) const BMNOEXCEPT;
442
443
444 ///@}
445
446
447 // ------------------------------------------------------------
448 /*! @name Access to internals */
449 ///@{
450
451 /*!
452 \brief get access to bit-plain, function checks and creates a plane
453 \return bit-vector for the bit plain
454 @internal
455 */
456 bvector_type_ptr get_create_slice(unsigned i);
457
458 /*!
459 \brief get read-only access to bit-plane
460 \return bit-vector for the bit plane or NULL
461 @internal
462 */
463 bvector_type_const_ptr
464 get_slice(unsigned i) const BMNOEXCEPT { return bmatr_.row(i); }
465
466 /*!
467 \brief get total number of bit-planes in the vector
468 @internal
469 */
470 static unsigned slices() BMNOEXCEPT { return value_bits(); }
471
472 /** Number of stored bit-planes (value planes + extra
473 @internal
474 */
475 static unsigned stored_slices() BMNOEXCEPT { return value_bits()+1; }
476
477
478 /** Number of effective bit-planes in the value type
479 @internal
480 */
481 unsigned effective_slices() const BMNOEXCEPT
482 { return effective_slices_ + 1; }
483
484 /*!
485 \brief get access to bit-plane as is (can return NULL)
486 @internal
487 */
488 bvector_type_ptr slice(unsigned i) BMNOEXCEPT { return bmatr_.get_row(i); }
489 bvector_type_const_ptr slice(unsigned i) const BMNOEXCEPT
490 { return bmatr_.get_row(i); }
491
492 bvector_type* get_null_bvect() BMNOEXCEPT
493 {
494 if (size_type null_idx = bmatr_.get_null_idx())
495 return bmatr_.get_row(null_idx);
496 return 0;
497 }
498
499 /*!
500 \brief free memory in bit-plane
501 @internal
502 */
503 void free_slice(unsigned i) { bmatr_.destruct_row(i); }
504
505 /*!
506 return mask of allocated bit-planes
507 1 in the mask - means bit-plane N is present
508 returns 64-bit unsigned mask for sub 64-bit types (like int)
509 unallocated mask bits will be zero extended
510
511 @return 64-bit mask
512 @internal
513 */
514 bm::id64_t get_slice_mask(unsigned element_idx) const BMNOEXCEPT;
515
516 /*!
517 get read-only access to inetrnal bit-matrix
518 @internal
519 */
520 const bmatrix_type& get_bmatrix() const BMNOEXCEPT { return bmatr_; }
521
522 /**
523 access to internal bit-matrix
524 @internal
525 */
526 bmatrix_type& get_bmatrix() BMNOEXCEPT { return bmatr_; }
527
528 /**
529 Set NULL plain index
530 @internal
531 */
532 void mark_null_idx(unsigned null_idx) BMNOEXCEPT
533 { bmatr_.null_idx_ = null_idx; }
534 /**
535 Convert signed value type to unsigned representation
536 @internal
537 */
538 static
539 unsigned_value_type s2u(value_type v) BMNOEXCEPT;
540
541 /**
542 Convert unsigned value type to signed representation
543 @internal
544 */
545 static
546 value_type u2s(unsigned_value_type v) BMNOEXCEPT;
547
548
549 ///@}
550 ///
551 // -------------------------------------------------------------------
552
553 /*!
554 \brief run memory optimization for all bit-vector rows
555 \param temp_block - pre-allocated memory block to avoid unnecessary re-allocs
556 \param opt_mode - requested compression depth
557 \param stat - memory allocation statistics after optimization
558 */
559 void optimize(bm::word_t* temp_block = 0,
560 typename bvector_type::optmode opt_mode = bvector_type::opt_compress,
561 typename bvector_type::statistics* stat = 0);
562
563 /*!
564 @brief Calculates memory statistics.
565
566 Function fills statistics structure containing information about how
567 this vector uses memory and estimation of max. amount of memory
568 bvector needs to serialize itself.
569
570 @param st - pointer on statistics structure to be filled in.
571
572 @sa statistics
573 */
574 void calc_stat(typename bvector_type::statistics* st) const BMNOEXCEPT;
575
576 /*!
577 \brief check if another sparse vector has the same content and size
578
579 \param sv - sparse vector for comparison
580 \param null_able - flag to consider NULL vector in comparison (default)
581 or compare only value content planes
582
583 \return true, if it is the same
584 */
585 bool equal(const base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>& sv,
586 bm::null_support null_able = bm::use_null) const BMNOEXCEPT;
587
588protected:
589 void copy_from(const base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>& bsv);
590
591 /**
592 Merge plane bvectors from an outside base matrix
593 Note: outside base matrix gets destroyed
594 */
595 void merge_matr(bmatrix_type& bmatr);
596
597 /**
598 Turn on RO mode
599 */
600 void freeze_matr() { bmatr_.freeze(); is_ro_ = true; }
601
602 /*!
603 clear column in all value planes
604 \param plane_idx - row (plane index to start from)
605 \param idx - bit (column) to clear
606 */
607 void clear_value_planes_from(unsigned plane_idx, size_type idx);
608
609 /*!
610 insert false (clear) column in all value planes
611 \param plane_idx - row (plane index to start from)
612 \param idx - bit (column) to clear insert
613 */
614 void insert_clear_value_planes_from(unsigned plane_idx, size_type idx);
615
616 /*!
617 erase bit (column) from all planes
618 \param idx - bit (column) to erase
619 \param erase_null - erase the NULL vector
620 */
621 void erase_column(size_type idx, bool erase_null);
622
623 /*!
624 insert (NOT) NULL value
625 */
626 void insert_null(size_type idx, bool not_null);
627
628 /**
629 Set SUB (MINUS) operation on all existing bit-slices
630 @param bv - argument vector row[i] -= bv
631 */
632 void bit_sub_rows(const bvector_type& bv, bool use_null)
633 { bmatr_.bit_sub_rows(bv, use_null); }
634
635 /**
636 Set AND (intersect) operation on all existing bit-slices
637 @param bv - argument vector row[i] -= bv
638 */
639 void bit_and_rows(const bvector_type& bv) { bmatr_.bit_and_rows(bv); }
640
641protected:
642 typedef typename bvector_type::block_idx_type block_idx_type;
643
644 /** Number of total bit-planes in the value type*/
645 static constexpr unsigned value_bits() BMNOEXCEPT
646 { return base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::sv_value_slices; }
647
648 /** plane index for the "NOT NULL" flags plane */
649 //static constexpr unsigned null_plane() BMNOEXCEPT { return value_bits(); }
650
651 /** optimize block in all matrix planes */
652 void optimize_block(block_idx_type nb) { bmatr_.optimize_block(nb); }
653
654 /**
655 Perform copy_range() on a set of planes
656 */
657 void copy_range_slices(
658 const base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>& bsv,
659 typename base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::size_type left,
660 typename base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::size_type right,
661 bm::null_support slice_null);
662
663protected:
664 bmatrix_type bmatr_; ///< bit-transposed matrix
665 unsigned_value_type slice_mask_ = 0; ///< slice presence bit-mask
666 size_type size_ = 0; ///< array size
667 unsigned effective_slices_=0; ///< number of bit slices actually allocated
668 bool is_ro_=false; ///< read-only
669};
670
671//---------------------------------------------------------------------
672//
673//---------------------------------------------------------------------
674
675#ifdef _MSC_VER
676#pragma warning( push )
677#pragma warning( disable : 4146 )
678#endif
679
680template<typename BV>
681basic_bmatrix<BV>::basic_bmatrix(size_type rsize,
682 allocation_policy_type ap,
683 size_type bv_max_size,
684 const allocator_type& alloc)
685: bv_size_(bv_max_size),
686 alloc_(alloc),
687 ap_(ap),
688 pool_(0),
689 bv_rows_(0),
690 rsize_(0),
691 null_idx_(0)
692{
693 allocate_rows(rsize);
694}
695
696//---------------------------------------------------------------------
697
698template<typename BV>
699basic_bmatrix<BV>::~basic_bmatrix() BMNOEXCEPT
700{
701 free_rows();
702}
703
704//---------------------------------------------------------------------
705
706template<typename BV>
707basic_bmatrix<BV>::basic_bmatrix(const basic_bmatrix<BV>& bbm)
708: bv_size_(bbm.bv_size_),
709 alloc_(bbm.alloc_),
710 ap_(bbm.ap_),
711 pool_(0),
712 bv_rows_(0),
713 rsize_(0),
714 null_idx_(0)
715{
716 copy_from(bbm);
717}
718
719//---------------------------------------------------------------------
720
721template<typename BV>
722basic_bmatrix<BV>::basic_bmatrix(basic_bmatrix<BV>&& bbm) BMNOEXCEPT
723: bv_size_(bbm.bv_size_),
724 alloc_(bbm.alloc_),
725 ap_(bbm.ap_),
726 pool_(0),
727 bv_rows_(0),
728 rsize_(0),
729 null_idx_(0)
730{
731 swap(bbm);
732}
733
734//---------------------------------------------------------------------
735
736template<typename BV>
737const typename basic_bmatrix<BV>::bvector_type*
738basic_bmatrix<BV>::row(size_type i) const BMNOEXCEPT
739{
740 BM_ASSERT(i < rsize_);
741 return bv_rows_[i];
742}
743
744//---------------------------------------------------------------------
745
746template<typename BV>
747const typename basic_bmatrix<BV>::bvector_type*
748basic_bmatrix<BV>::get_row(size_type i) const BMNOEXCEPT
749{
750 BM_ASSERT(i < rsize_);
751 return bv_rows_[i];
752}
753
754//---------------------------------------------------------------------
755
756template<typename BV>
757typename basic_bmatrix<BV>::bvector_type*
758basic_bmatrix<BV>::get_row(size_type i) BMNOEXCEPT
759{
760 BM_ASSERT(i < rsize_);
761 return bv_rows_[i];
762}
763
764//---------------------------------------------------------------------
765
766template<typename BV>
767void basic_bmatrix<BV>::set_null_idx(size_type null_idx) BMNOEXCEPT
768{
769 BM_ASSERT(null_idx);
770 BM_ASSERT(get_row(null_idx));
771 null_idx_ = null_idx;
772}
773
774//---------------------------------------------------------------------
775
776template<typename BV>
777void basic_bmatrix<BV>::copy_from(const basic_bmatrix<BV>& bbm)
778{
779 if (this == &bbm) // nothing to do
780 return;
781 free_rows();
782
783 bv_size_ = bbm.bv_size_;
784 alloc_ = bbm.alloc_;
785 ap_ = bbm.ap_;
786
787 null_idx_ = bbm.null_idx_;
788
789 size_type rsize = bbm.rsize_;
790 if (rsize)
791 {
792 bv_rows_ = (bvector_type_ptr*)alloc_.alloc_ptr(rsize);
793 if (!bv_rows_)
794 throw_bad_alloc();
795 rsize_ = rsize;
796 for (size_type i = 0; i < rsize_; ++i)
797 {
798 const bvector_type_ptr bv = bbm.bv_rows_[i];
799 bv_rows_[i] = bv ? construct_bvector(bv) : 0;
800 }
801 }
802}
803
804//---------------------------------------------------------------------
805
806template<typename BV>
807void basic_bmatrix<BV>::erase_column(size_type idx, bool erase_null)
808{
809 // relies that NULL bvector is the last
810 size_type r_to = (!erase_null && null_idx_) ? null_idx_ : rsize_;
811 for (size_type i = 0; i < r_to; ++i)
812 if (bvector_type* bv = get_row(i))
813 bv->erase(idx);
814}
815
816//---------------------------------------------------------------------
817
818template<typename BV>
819void basic_bmatrix<BV>::insert_column(size_type idx,
820 size_type row_from)
821{
822 for (size_type i = row_from; i < rsize_; ++i)
823 if (bvector_type* bv = get_row(i))
824 bv->insert(idx, false);
825}
826
827//---------------------------------------------------------------------
828
829template<typename BV>
830void basic_bmatrix<BV>::clear_column(size_type idx,
831 size_type row_from)
832{
833 for (size_type i = row_from; i < rsize_; ++i)
834 if (bvector_type* bv = get_row(i))
835 bv->clear_bit_no_check(idx);
836}
837
838//---------------------------------------------------------------------
839
840template<typename BV>
841void basic_bmatrix<BV>::allocate_rows(size_type rsize)
842{
843 size_type rsize_prev(rsize_);
844 if (rsize <= rsize_prev)
845 return; // nothing to do
846 bvector_type_ptr* bv_rows_prev(bv_rows_);
847
848 BM_ASSERT(rsize);
849 bv_rows_ = (bvector_type_ptr*)alloc_.alloc_ptr(unsigned(rsize));
850 if (!bv_rows_)
851 throw_bad_alloc();
852 rsize_ = rsize;
853 BM_ASSERT((!null_idx_) || (rsize & 1u));
854 ::memset(&bv_rows_[0], 0, rsize * sizeof(bv_rows_[0]));
855 if (bv_rows_prev) // deallocate prev, reset NULL
856 {
857 for (size_type i = 0; i < rsize_prev; ++i)
858 bv_rows_[i] = bv_rows_prev[i];
859 alloc_.free_ptr(bv_rows_prev, unsigned(rsize_prev));
860 if (null_idx_) // shift-up the NULL row
861 {
862 bv_rows_[rsize-1] = bv_rows_[null_idx_];
863 bv_rows_[null_idx_] = 0;
864 null_idx_ = rsize-1;
865 }
866 }
867}
868
869//---------------------------------------------------------------------
870
871template<typename BV>
872typename basic_bmatrix<BV>::size_type
873basic_bmatrix<BV>::octet_size() const BMNOEXCEPT
874{
875 size_type osize = (7 + rows_not_null()) / 8;
876 return osize;
877}
878
879
880//---------------------------------------------------------------------
881
882template<typename BV>
883void basic_bmatrix<BV>::free_rows() BMNOEXCEPT
884{
885 for (size_type i = 0; i < rsize_; ++i)
886 {
887 if (bvector_type_ptr bv = bv_rows_[i])
888 {
889 destruct_bvector(bv);
890 bv_rows_[i] = 0;
891 }
892 } // for i
893 if (bv_rows_)
894 alloc_.free_ptr(bv_rows_, unsigned(rsize_));
895 bv_rows_ = 0;
896}
897
898//---------------------------------------------------------------------
899
900template<typename BV>
901typename basic_bmatrix<BV>::size_type
902basic_bmatrix<BV>::calc_effective_rows_not_null() const BMNOEXCEPT
903{
904 // TODO: SIMD
905 auto i = rows_not_null();
906 for (--i; i > 0; --i)
907 {
908 if (bv_rows_[i])
909 {
910 ++i;
911 break;
912 }
913 }
914 return i;
915}
916
917//---------------------------------------------------------------------
918
919template<typename BV>
920void basic_bmatrix<BV>::bit_sub_rows(const bvector_type& bv, bool use_null)
921{
922 size_type sz = use_null ? rsize_: calc_effective_rows_not_null();
923 for (size_type i = 0; i < sz; ++i)
924 {
925 if (bvector_type_ptr bv_r = bv_rows_[i])
926 bv_r->bit_sub(bv);
927 } // for i
928}
929
930//---------------------------------------------------------------------
931
932template<typename BV>
933void basic_bmatrix<BV>::bit_and_rows(const bvector_type& bv)
934{
935 for (size_type i = 0; i < rsize_; ++i)
936 {
937 if (bvector_type_ptr bv_r = bv_rows_[i])
938 bv_r->bit_and(bv);
939 } // for i
940}
941
942//---------------------------------------------------------------------
943
944template<typename BV>
945void basic_bmatrix<BV>::swap(basic_bmatrix<BV>& bbm) BMNOEXCEPT
946{
947 if (this == &bbm)
948 return;
949
950 bm::xor_swap(bv_size_, bbm.bv_size_);
951
952 allocator_type alloc_tmp = alloc_;
953 alloc_ = bbm.alloc_;
954 bbm.alloc_ = alloc_tmp;
955
956 allocation_policy_type ap_tmp = ap_;
957 ap_ = bbm.ap_;
958 bbm.ap_ = ap_tmp;
959
960 allocator_pool_type* pool_tmp = pool_;
961 pool_ = bbm.pool_;
962 bbm.pool_ = pool_tmp;
963
964 bm::xor_swap(rsize_, bbm.rsize_);
965 bm::xor_swap(null_idx_, bbm.null_idx_);
966
967 bvector_type_ptr* rtmp = bv_rows_;
968 bv_rows_ = bbm.bv_rows_;
969 bbm.bv_rows_ = rtmp;
970}
971
972//---------------------------------------------------------------------
973
974template<typename BV>
975typename basic_bmatrix<BV>::bvector_type_ptr
976basic_bmatrix<BV>::construct_row(size_type row)
977{
978 if (row > rsize_)
979 allocate_rows(row + 8);
980 BM_ASSERT(row < rsize_);
981 bvector_type_ptr bv = bv_rows_[row];
982 if (!bv)
983 bv = bv_rows_[row] = construct_bvector(0);
984 return bv;
985}
986
987//---------------------------------------------------------------------
988
989template<typename BV>
990typename basic_bmatrix<BV>::bvector_type_ptr
991basic_bmatrix<BV>::construct_row(size_type row, const bvector_type& bv_src)
992{
993 if (row > rsize_)
994 allocate_rows(row + 8);
995 BM_ASSERT(row < rsize_);
996 bvector_type_ptr bv = bv_rows_[row];
997 if (bv)
998 *bv = bv_src;
999 else
1000 bv = bv_rows_[row] = construct_bvector(&bv_src);
1001 return bv;
1002}
1003
1004
1005//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1006
1007template<typename BV>
1008void basic_bmatrix<BV>::destruct_row(size_type row)
1009{
1010 BM_ASSERT(row < rsize_);
1011 if (bvector_type_ptr bv = bv_rows_[row])
1012 {
1013 destruct_bvector(bv);
1014 bv_rows_[row] = 0;
1015 }
1016}
1017
1018//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1019
1020template<typename BV>
1021void basic_bmatrix<BV>::clear_row(size_type row, bool free_mem)
1022{
1023 BM_ASSERT(row < rsize_);
1024 if (bvector_type_ptr bv = bv_rows_[row])
1025 {
1026 if (free_mem)
1027 {
1028 destruct_bvector(bv);
1029 bv_rows_[row] = 0;
1030 }
1031 else
1032 bv->clear(true);
1033 }
1034}
1035
1036//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1037
1038template<typename BV>
1039typename basic_bmatrix<BV>::bvector_type*
1040basic_bmatrix<BV>::construct_bvector(const bvector_type* bv) const
1041{
1042 bvector_type* rbv = 0;
1043#ifdef BM_NO_STL // C compatibility mode
1044 void* mem = ::malloc(sizeof(bvector_type));
1045 if (mem == 0)
1046 {
1047 BM_THROW(false, BM_ERR_BADALLOC);
1048 }
1049 if (bv)
1050 rbv = new(mem) bvector_type(*bv);
1051 else
1052 {
1053 rbv = new(mem) bvector_type(ap_.strat, ap_.glevel_len, bv_size_, alloc_);
1054 rbv->init();
1055 }
1056#else
1057 if (bv)
1058 rbv = new bvector_type(*bv);
1059 else
1060 {
1061 rbv = new bvector_type(ap_.strat, ap_.glevel_len, bv_size_, alloc_);
1062 rbv->init();
1063 }
1064#endif
1065 return rbv;
1066}
1067
1068//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1069
1070template<typename BV>
1071void basic_bmatrix<BV>::destruct_bvector(bvector_type* bv) const
1072{
1073#ifdef BM_NO_STL // C compatibility mode
1074 bv->~TBM_bvector();
1075 ::free((void*)bv);
1076#else
1077 delete bv;
1078#endif
1079}
1080
1081//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1082
1083template<typename BV>
1084const bm::word_t*
1085basic_bmatrix<BV>::get_block(size_type p,
1086 unsigned i, unsigned j) const BMNOEXCEPT
1087{
1088 if (bvector_type_const_ptr bv = this->row(p))
1089 return bv->get_blocks_manager().get_block_ptr(i, j);
1090 return 0;
1091}
1092
1093//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1094
1095template<typename BV>
1096void basic_bmatrix<BV>::clear_slices_range(
1097 unsigned slice_from, unsigned slice_until,
1098 size_type idx)
1099{
1100 for (unsigned p = slice_from; p < slice_until; ++p)
1101 if (bvector_type* bv = this->get_row(p)) // TODO: optimize cleaning
1102 bv->clear_bit_no_check(idx);
1103}
1104
1105
1106//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1107
1108template<typename BV>
1109void basic_bmatrix<BV>::set_octet(size_type pos,
1110 size_type octet_idx,
1111 unsigned char octet)
1112{
1113 if (7u + octet_idx * 8u > rsize_)
1114 allocate_rows(rsize_ + 16);
1115
1116 size_type row = octet_idx * 8;
1117 size_type row_end = row + 8;
1118 for (; row < row_end; ++row)
1119 {
1120 bvector_type* bv = (row < rsize_) ? this->get_row(row) : 0;
1121 if (octet & 1u)
1122 {
1123 if (!bv)
1124 bv = this->construct_row(row);
1125 bv->set_bit_no_check(pos);
1126 }
1127 else
1128 {
1129 if (bv)
1130 bv->clear_bit_no_check(pos);
1131 }
1132 octet >>= 1;
1133 if (!octet)
1134 break;
1135 } // for
1136
1137 // clear the tail
1138 if (row_end > rsize_)
1139 row_end = rsize_;
1140 for (++row; row < row_end; ++row)
1141 if (bvector_type* bv = this->get_row(row))
1142 bv->clear_bit_no_check(pos);
1143}
1144
1145//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1146
1147template<typename BV>
1148void basic_bmatrix<BV>::insert_octet(size_type pos,
1149 size_type octet_idx,
1150 unsigned char octet)
1151{
1152 BM_ASSERT(octet_idx * 8u < rsize_);
1153
1154 size_type oct = octet;
1155 size_type row = octet_idx * 8;
1156 size_type row_end = row + 8;
1157 for (; row < row_end; ++row)
1158 {
1159 bvector_type* bv = (row < rsize_) ? this->get_row(row) : 0;
1160 if (oct & 1u)
1161 {
1162 if (!bv)
1163 {
1164 bv = this->construct_row(row);
1165 bv->set_bit_no_check(pos);
1166 }
1167 else
1168 {
1169 bv->insert(pos, true);
1170 }
1171 }
1172 else
1173 {
1174 if (bv)
1175 bv->insert(pos, false);
1176 }
1177 oct >>= 1;
1178 if (!oct)
1179 break;
1180 } // for
1181
1182 // clear the tail
1183 if (row_end > rsize_)
1184 row_end = rsize_;
1185 for (++row; row < row_end; ++row)
1186 if (bvector_type* bv = this->get_row(row))
1187 bv->insert(pos, false);
1188}
1189
1190
1191//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1192
1193template<typename BV>
1194unsigned char
1195basic_bmatrix<BV>::get_octet(size_type pos, size_type octet_idx) const BMNOEXCEPT
1196{
1197 unsigned v = 0;
1198
1199 block_idx_type nb = (pos >> bm::set_block_shift);
1200 unsigned i0 = unsigned(nb >> bm::set_array_shift); // top block address
1201 unsigned j0 = unsigned(nb & bm::set_array_mask); // address in sub-block
1202
1203 const bm::word_t* blk;
1204 const bm::word_t* blka[8];
1205 unsigned nbit = unsigned(pos & bm::set_block_mask);
1206 unsigned nword = unsigned(nbit >> bm::set_word_shift);
1207 unsigned mask0 = 1u << (nbit & bm::set_word_mask);
1208
1209 unsigned row_idx = unsigned(octet_idx * 8);
1210 if (row_idx + 7 >= rsize_ ||
1211 (null_idx_ && (row_idx + 7 > null_idx_))) // out of bounds request?
1212 return (unsigned char)v;
1213
1214 blka[0] = get_block(row_idx+0, i0, j0);
1215 blka[1] = get_block(row_idx+1, i0, j0);
1216 blka[2] = get_block(row_idx+2, i0, j0);
1217 blka[3] = get_block(row_idx+3, i0, j0);
1218 blka[4] = get_block(row_idx+4, i0, j0);
1219 blka[5] = get_block(row_idx+5, i0, j0);
1220 blka[6] = get_block(row_idx+6, i0, j0);
1221 blka[7] = get_block(row_idx+7, i0, j0);
1222 unsigned is_set;
1223
1224 if ((blk = blka[0])!=0)
1225 {
1226 if (blk == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
1227 is_set = 1;
1228 else
1229 is_set = (BM_IS_GAP(blk)) ? bm::gap_test_unr(BMGAP_PTR(blk), nbit) : (blk[nword] & mask0);
1230 v |= (unsigned)bool(is_set);
1231 }
1232 if ((blk = blka[1])!=0)
1233 {
1234 if (blk == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
1235 is_set = 1;
1236 else
1237 is_set = (BM_IS_GAP(blk)) ? bm::gap_test_unr(BMGAP_PTR(blk), nbit) : (blk[nword] & mask0);
1238 v |= unsigned(bool(is_set)) << 1u;
1239 }
1240 if ((blk = blka[2])!=0)
1241 {
1242 if (blk == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
1243 is_set = 1;
1244 else
1245 is_set = (BM_IS_GAP(blk)) ? bm::gap_test_unr(BMGAP_PTR(blk), nbit) : (blk[nword] & mask0);
1246 v |= unsigned(bool(is_set)) << 2u;
1247 }
1248 if ((blk = blka[3])!=0)
1249 {
1250 if (blk == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
1251 is_set = 1;
1252 else
1253 is_set = (BM_IS_GAP(blk)) ? bm::gap_test_unr(BMGAP_PTR(blk), nbit) : (blk[nword] & mask0);
1254 v |= unsigned(bool(is_set)) << 3u;
1255 }
1256
1257
1258 if ((blk = blka[4])!=0)
1259 {
1260 if (blk == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
1261 is_set = 1;
1262 else
1263 is_set = (BM_IS_GAP(blk)) ? bm::gap_test_unr(BMGAP_PTR(blk), nbit) : (blk[nword] & mask0);
1264 v |= unsigned(bool(is_set)) << 4u;
1265 }
1266 if ((blk = blka[5])!=0)
1267 {
1268 if (blk == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
1269 is_set = 1;
1270 else
1271 is_set = (BM_IS_GAP(blk)) ? bm::gap_test_unr(BMGAP_PTR(blk), nbit) : (blk[nword] & mask0);
1272 v |= unsigned(bool(is_set)) << 5u;
1273 }
1274 if ((blk = blka[6])!=0)
1275 {
1276 if (blk == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
1277 is_set = 1;
1278 else
1279 is_set = (BM_IS_GAP(blk)) ? bm::gap_test_unr(BMGAP_PTR(blk), nbit) : (blk[nword] & mask0);
1280 v |= unsigned(bool(is_set)) << 6u;
1281 }
1282 if ((blk = blka[7])!=0)
1283 {
1284 if (blk == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
1285 is_set = 1;
1286 else
1287 is_set = (BM_IS_GAP(blk)) ? bm::gap_test_unr(BMGAP_PTR(blk), nbit) : (blk[nword] & mask0);
1288 v |= unsigned(bool(is_set)) << 7u;
1289 }
1290
1291 return (unsigned char)v;
1292}
1293
1294//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1295
1296template<typename BV>
1297int basic_bmatrix<BV>::compare_octet(size_type pos,
1298 size_type octet_idx,
1299 char octet) const BMNOEXCEPT
1300{
1301 char value = char(get_octet(pos, octet_idx));
1302 return (value > octet) - (value < octet);
1303}
1304
1305//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1306
1307/**
1308 Test 4 pointers are all marked as GAPs
1309 @internal
1310 */
1311inline
1312bool test_4gaps(const bm::word_t* p0, const bm::word_t* p1,
1313 const bm::word_t* p2, const bm::word_t* p3) BMNOEXCEPT
1314{
1315 uintptr_t p
1316 = uintptr_t(p0) | uintptr_t(p1) | uintptr_t(p2) | uintptr_t(p3);
1317 return (p & 1);
1318}
1319/**
1320 Test 4 pointers are not NULL and not marked as FULLBLOCK
1321 @internal
1322*/
1323inline
1324bool test_4bits(const bm::word_t* p0, const bm::word_t* p1,
1325 const bm::word_t* p2, const bm::word_t* p3) BMNOEXCEPT
1326{
1327 return p0 && p0!=FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR &&
1328 p1 && p1!=FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR &&
1329 p2 && p2!=FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR &&
1330 p3 && p3!=FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR;
1331}
1332
1333
1334template<typename BV>
1335unsigned
1336basic_bmatrix<BV>::get_half_octet(size_type pos, size_type row_idx) const BMNOEXCEPT
1337{
1338 unsigned v = 0;
1339
1340 block_idx_type nb = (pos >> bm::set_block_shift);
1341 unsigned i0 = unsigned(nb >> bm::set_array_shift); // top block address
1342 unsigned j0 = unsigned(nb & bm::set_array_mask); // address in sub-block
1343
1344 const bm::word_t* blk;
1345 const bm::word_t* blka[4];
1346 unsigned nbit = unsigned(pos & bm::set_block_mask);
1347
1348 blka[0] = get_block(row_idx+0, i0, j0);
1349 blka[1] = get_block(row_idx+1, i0, j0);
1350 blka[2] = get_block(row_idx+2, i0, j0);
1351 blka[3] = get_block(row_idx+3, i0, j0);
1352 unsigned is_set;
1353
1354
1355 unsigned nword = unsigned(nbit >> bm::set_word_shift);
1356 unsigned mask0 = 1u << (nbit & bm::set_word_mask);
1357
1358 // speculative assumption that nibble is often 4 bit-blocks
1359 // and we will be able to extract it faster with less mispredicts
1360 //
1361 if (!test_4gaps(blka[0], blka[1], blka[2], blka[3]))
1362 {
1363 if (test_4bits(blka[0], blka[1], blka[2], blka[3]))
1364 {
1365 v = unsigned(bool((blka[0][nword] & mask0))) |
1366 unsigned(bool((blka[1][nword] & mask0)) << 1u) |
1367 unsigned(bool((blka[2][nword] & mask0)) << 2u) |
1368 unsigned(bool((blka[3][nword] & mask0)) << 3u);
1369 return v;
1370 }
1371 }
1372 // hypothesis above didn't work out extract the regular way
1373 unsigned i = 0;
1374 do
1375 {
1376 if ((blk = blka[i])!=0)
1377 {
1378 if (blk == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
1379 is_set = 1;
1380 else
1381 is_set = (BM_IS_GAP(blk)) ? bm::gap_test_unr(BMGAP_PTR(blk), nbit) : (blk[nword] & mask0);
1382 v |= unsigned(bool(is_set)) << i;
1383 }
1384 if ((blk = blka[++i])!=0)
1385 {
1386 if (blk == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
1387 is_set = 1;
1388 else
1389 is_set = (BM_IS_GAP(blk)) ? bm::gap_test_unr(BMGAP_PTR(blk), nbit) : (blk[nword] & mask0);
1390 v |= unsigned(bool(is_set)) << i;
1391 }
1392 } while(++i < 4);
1393 return v;
1394}
1395
1396//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1397
1398template<typename BV>
1399void basic_bmatrix<BV>::optimize(bm::word_t* temp_block,
1400 typename bvector_type::optmode opt_mode,
1401 typename bvector_type::statistics* st)
1402{
1403 if (st)
1404 st->reset();
1405
1406 BM_DECLARE_TEMP_BLOCK(tb)
1407 if (!temp_block)
1408 temp_block = tb;
1409
1410 for (unsigned k = 0; k < rsize_; ++k)
1411 {
1412 if (bvector_type* bv = get_row(k))
1413 {
1414 typename bvector_type::statistics stbv;
1415 stbv.reset();
1416 bv->optimize(temp_block, opt_mode, st ? &stbv : 0);
1417 if (st)
1418 st->add(stbv);
1419 }
1420 } // for k
1421}
1422
1423//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1424
1425template<typename BV>
1426void basic_bmatrix<BV>::freeze()
1427{
1428 for (unsigned k = 0; k < rsize_; ++k)
1429 if (bvector_type* bv = get_row(k))
1430 bv->freeze();
1431}
1432
1433//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1434
1435template<typename BV>
1436void basic_bmatrix<BV>::calc_stat(typename bvector_type::statistics& st,
1437 size_type rsize) const BMNOEXCEPT
1438{
1439 for (size_type i = 0; i < rsize; ++i)
1440 if (const bvector_type* bv = row(i))
1441 {
1442 typename bvector_type::statistics stbv;
1443 bv->calc_stat(&stbv);
1444 st.add(stbv);
1445 }
1446 else
1447 st.max_serialize_mem += 8;
1448}
1449
1450//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1451
1452template<typename BV>
1453void basic_bmatrix<BV>::optimize_block(block_idx_type nb)
1454{
1455 for (unsigned k = 0; k < rsize_; ++k)
1456 {
1457 if (bvector_type* bv = get_row(k))
1458 {
1459 unsigned i, j;
1460 bm::get_block_coord(nb, i, j);
1461 typename bvector_type::blocks_manager_type& bman =
1462 bv->get_blocks_manager();
1463 bman.optimize_bit_block(i, j);
1464 }
1465 } // for k
1466
1467}
1468
1469//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1470//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1471
1472
1473
1474template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1475base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::base_sparse_vector()
1476: bmatr_(sv_slices, allocation_policy_type(), bm::id_max, allocator_type())
1477{}
1478
1479//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1480
1481template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1482base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::base_sparse_vector(
1483 bm::null_support null_able,
1484 allocation_policy_type ap,
1485 size_type bv_max_size,
1486 const allocator_type& alloc)
1487: bmatr_(sv_slices, ap, bv_max_size, alloc)
1488{
1489 if (null_able == bm::use_null)
1490 {
1491 size_type null_idx = (MAX_SIZE * sizeof(Val) * 8);
1492 bmatr_.construct_row(null_idx)->init();
1493 bmatr_.set_null_idx(null_idx);
1494 slice_mask_ |= unsigned_value_type(1) << null_idx;
1495 }
1496}
1497
1498//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1499
1500template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1501base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::base_sparse_vector(
1502 const base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>& bsv)
1503: bmatr_(bsv.bmatr_),
1504 slice_mask_(bsv.slice_mask_),
1505 size_(bsv.size_),
1506 effective_slices_(bsv.effective_slices_)
1507{}
1508
1509//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1510
1511template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1512void base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::copy_from(
1513 const base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>& bsv)
1514{
1515 resize(bsv.size(), true);
1516 effective_slices_ = bsv.effective_slices_;
1517
1518 size_type arg_null_idx = bsv.bmatr_.get_null_idx();
1519 if (arg_null_idx)
1520 bmatr_.null_idx_ = arg_null_idx;
1521
1522 size_type slices = bsv.get_bmatrix().rows(); //stored_slices();
1523 bmatr_.allocate_rows(slices);
1524 for (size_type i = 0; i < slices; ++i)
1525 {
1526 bvector_type* bv = bmatr_.get_row(i);
1527 const bvector_type* bv_src = bsv.bmatr_.row(i);
1528
1529 if (i && (i == arg_null_idx)) // NULL plane copy
1530 {
1531 if (bv && !bv_src) // special case (copy from not NULL)
1532 {
1533 if (size_)
1534 bv->set_range(0, size_-1);
1535 continue;
1536 }
1537 }
1538 if (bv)
1539 {
1540 bmatr_.destruct_row(i);
1541 slice_mask_ &= ~(unsigned_value_type(1) << i);
1542 }
1543 if (bv_src)
1544 {
1545 bmatr_.construct_row(i, *bv_src);
1546 slice_mask_ |= (unsigned_value_type(1) << i);
1547 }
1548 } // for i
1549}
1550
1551//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1552
1553template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1554void base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::merge_matr(
1555 bmatrix_type& bmatr)
1556{
1557 size_type rows = this->bmatr_.rows();
1558 const size_type arg_rows = bmatr.rows();
1559 if (rows < arg_rows)
1560 {
1561 rows = arg_rows;
1562 bmatr_.allocate_rows(rows);
1563 BM_ASSERT(this->bmatr_.rows() == arg_rows);
1564 }
1565
1566 bvector_type* bv_null_arg = 0;
1567 size_type null_idx = bmatr.get_null_idx();
1568 if (null_idx)
1569 bv_null_arg = bmatr.get_row(null_idx);
1570
1571 if (bvector_type* bv_null = get_null_bvect())
1572 {
1573 BM_ASSERT(bv_null_arg);
1574 bv_null->merge(*bv_null_arg);
1575 }
1576 if (rows > arg_rows)
1577 rows = arg_rows; // min
1578 for (unsigned j = 0; j < rows; ++j)
1579 {
1580 bvector_type* arg_bv = bmatr.get_row(j);
1581 if (arg_bv && arg_bv != bv_null_arg)
1582 {
1583 bvector_type* bv = this->get_create_slice(j);
1584 slice_mask_ |= (unsigned_value_type(1) << j);
1585 bv->merge(*arg_bv);
1586 }
1587 } // for j
1588}
1589
1590//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1591
1592template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1593void base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::swap(
1594 base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>& bsv) BMNOEXCEPT
1595{
1596 if (this != &bsv)
1597 {
1598 bmatr_.swap(bsv.bmatr_);
1599 bm::xor_swap(slice_mask_, bsv.slice_mask_);
1600 bm::xor_swap(size_, bsv.size_);
1601 bm::xor_swap(effective_slices_, bsv.effective_slices_);
1602 }
1603}
1604
1605//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1606
1607template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1608void base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::clear_all(bool free_mem) BMNOEXCEPT
1609{
1610 unsigned slices = value_bits();
1611 for (size_type i = 0; i < slices; ++i)
1612 bmatr_.clear_row(i, free_mem);
1613 slice_mask_ = 0; size_ = 0;
1614 if (bvector_type* bv_null = get_null_bvect())
1615 bv_null->clear(true);
1616}
1617
1618//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1619
1620template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1621void base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::clear_range(
1622 typename base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::size_type left,
1623 typename base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::size_type right,
1624 bool set_null)
1625{
1626 if (right < left)
1627 return clear_range(right, left, set_null);
1628 unsigned planes = value_bits();
1629 for (unsigned i = 0; i < planes; ++i)
1630 {
1631 if (bvector_type* bv = this->bmatr_.get_row(i))
1632 {
1633 BM_ASSERT(bv != this->get_null_bvect());
1634 bv->set_range(left, right, false);
1635 }
1636 }
1637 if (set_null)
1638 if (bvector_type* bv_null = this->get_null_bvect())
1639 bv_null->set_range(left, right, false);
1640}
1641
1642//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1643
1644template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1645void base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::keep_range_no_check(
1646 size_type left, size_type right,
1647 bm::null_support slice_null)
1648{
1649 if (left)
1650 this->clear_range(0, left-1, (slice_null == bm::use_null));
1651 size_type sz = size();
1652 if (right < sz)
1653 this->clear_range(right + 1, sz, (slice_null == bm::use_null));
1654}
1655
1656//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1657
1658template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1659void base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::resize(size_type sz, bool set_null)
1660{
1661 if (sz == size()) // nothing to do
1662 return;
1663 if (!sz) // resize to zero is an equivalent of non-destructive deallocation
1664 {
1665 clear_all();
1666 return;
1667 }
1668 if (sz < size()) // vector shrink
1669 clear_range(sz, this->size_, set_null); // clear the tails and NULL
1670 size_ = sz;
1671}
1672
1673
1674//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1675
1676template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1677bool base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::is_null(
1678 size_type idx) const BMNOEXCEPT
1679{
1680 const bvector_type* bv_null = get_null_bvector();
1681 return (bv_null) ? (!bv_null->test(idx)) : false;
1682}
1683
1684//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1685
1686template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1687void base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::insert_null(size_type idx,
1688 bool not_null)
1689{
1690 if (bvector_type* bv_null = this->get_null_bvect())
1691 bv_null->insert(idx, not_null);
1692}
1693
1694//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1695
1696template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1697typename base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::bvector_type_ptr
1698base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::get_create_slice(unsigned i)
1699{
1700 bvector_type_ptr bv = bmatr_.construct_row(i);
1701
1702 // slice mask or efective_slices does not extend beyond the natural size
1703 // (in bits)
1704 if (i < (sizeof(value_type) * 8))
1705 {
1706 // note: unsigned int shift by << 32 is UNDEFINED behav.
1707 slice_mask_ |= (unsigned_value_type(1) << i);
1708 if (i > effective_slices_)
1709 effective_slices_ = i;
1710 }
1711 return bv;
1712}
1713
1714//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1715
1716template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1717bm::id64_t base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::get_slice_mask(
1718 unsigned element_idx) const BMNOEXCEPT
1719{
1720 bm::id64_t mask = 0;
1721 bm::id64_t mask1 = 1;
1722 const unsigned planes = sizeof(value_type) * 8;
1723 unsigned bidx = 0;
1724 unsigned slice_size = (element_idx+1) * planes;
1725 if (slice_size > this->bmatr_.rows())
1726 slice_size = (unsigned) this->bmatr_.rows();
1727 for (unsigned i = element_idx * planes; i < slice_size; ++i, ++bidx)
1728 mask |= get_slice(i) ? (mask1 << bidx) : 0ull;
1729 return mask;
1730}
1731
1732//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1733
1734template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1735void base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::optimize(bm::word_t* temp_block,
1736 typename bvector_type::optmode opt_mode,
1737 typename bvector_type::statistics* st)
1738{
1739 typename bvector_type::statistics stbv;
1740 bmatr_.optimize(temp_block, opt_mode, &stbv);
1741 if (st)
1742 st->add(stbv);
1743
1744 bvector_type* bv_null = this->get_null_bvect();
1745 unsigned slices = (unsigned)this->bmatr_.rows();
1746 for (unsigned j = 0; j < slices; ++j)
1747 {
1748 bvector_type* bv = this->bmatr_.get_row(j);
1749 if (bv && (bv != bv_null)) // protect the NULL vector from de-allocation
1750 {
1751 // TODO: check if this can be done within optimize loop
1752 if (!bv->any()) // empty vector?
1753 {
1754 this->bmatr_.destruct_row(j);
1755 slice_mask_ &= ~(unsigned_value_type(1) << j);
1756 continue;
1757 }
1758 }
1759 } // for j
1760}
1761
1762//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1763
1764template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1765void base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::calc_stat(
1766 typename bvector_type::statistics* st) const BMNOEXCEPT
1767{
1768 BM_ASSERT(st);
1769 st->reset();
1770 size_type slices = this->get_bmatrix().rows();//stored_slices();
1771 bmatr_.calc_stat(*st, slices);
1772
1773 // header accounting
1774 st->max_serialize_mem += 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 8 + (8 * slices);
1775 st->max_serialize_mem += 1 + 8; // extra header fields for large bit-matrixes
1776}
1777
1778//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1779
1780template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1781void base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::clear_value_planes_from(
1782 unsigned plane_idx, size_type idx)
1783{
1784 bmatr_.clear_column(idx, plane_idx);
1785}
1786
1787//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1788
1789template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1790void base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::insert_clear_value_planes_from(
1791 unsigned plane_idx, size_type idx)
1792{
1793 bmatr_.insert_column(idx, plane_idx);
1794}
1795
1796//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1797
1798template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1799void base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::erase_column(
1800 size_type idx, bool erase_null)
1801{
1802 bmatr_.erase_column(idx, erase_null);
1803}
1804
1805//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1806
1807template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1808bool base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::equal(
1809 const base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>& sv,
1810 bm::null_support null_able) const BMNOEXCEPT
1811{
1812 if (size_type arg_size = sv.size(); this->size_ != arg_size)
1813 return false;
1814
1815 unsigned slices = (unsigned) this->bmatr_.rows();
1816 unsigned arg_slices = (unsigned) sv.bmatr_.rows();
1817 unsigned max_slices(slices);
1818 if (max_slices < arg_slices)
1819 max_slices = arg_slices;
1820
1821 const bvector_type* bv_null = this->get_null_bvector();
1822 const bvector_type* bv_null_arg = sv.get_null_bvector();
1823
1824 for (unsigned j = 0; j < max_slices; ++j)
1825 {
1826 const bvector_type* bv;
1827 const bvector_type* arg_bv;
1828
1829 bv = (j < slices) ? this->bmatr_.get_row(j) : 0;
1830 arg_bv = (j < arg_slices) ? sv.bmatr_.get_row(j) : 0;
1831 if (bv == bv_null)
1832 bv = 0; // NULL vector compare postponed for later
1833 if (arg_bv == bv_null_arg)
1834 arg_bv = 0;
1835 if (bv == arg_bv) // same NULL
1836 continue;
1837
1838 // check if any not NULL and not empty
1839 if (!bv && arg_bv)
1840 {
1841 if (arg_bv->any())
1842 return false;
1843 continue;
1844 }
1845 if (bv && !arg_bv)
1846 {
1847 if (bv->any())
1848 return false;
1849 continue;
1850 }
1851 // both not NULL
1852 bool eq = bv->equal(*arg_bv);
1853 if (!eq)
1854 return false;
1855 } // for j
1856
1857 if (null_able == bm::use_null)
1858 {
1859 // check the NULL vectors
1860 if (bv_null == bv_null_arg)
1861 return true;
1862 if (!bv_null || !bv_null_arg)
1863 return false; // TODO: this may need an improvement when one is null, others not null
1864
1865 BM_ASSERT(bv_null);
1866 BM_ASSERT(bv_null_arg);
1867 bool eq = bv_null->equal(*bv_null_arg);
1868 if (!eq)
1869 return false;
1870 }
1871 return true;
1872}
1873
1874//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1875
1876template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1877void base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::copy_range_slices(
1878 const base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>& bsv,
1879 typename base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::size_type left,
1880 typename base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::size_type right,
1881 bm::null_support slice_null)
1882{
1883 if (bmatr_.rows() < bsv.bmatr_.rows())
1884 bmatr_.allocate_rows(bsv.bmatr_.rows());
1885
1886 size_type spli;
1887 const bvector_type* bv_null_arg = bsv.get_null_bvector();
1888 if (bvector_type* bv_null = get_null_bvect())
1889 {
1890 spli = this->bmatr_.rows(); //stored_slices();
1891 if (bv_null_arg && (slice_null == bm::use_null))
1892 bv_null->copy_range(*bv_null_arg, left, right);
1893 --spli;
1894 }
1895 else
1896 spli = this->bmatr_.rows();
1897
1898 for (size_type j = 0; j < spli; ++j)
1899 {
1900 if (const bvector_type* arg_bv = bsv.bmatr_.row(j))
1901 {
1902 if (arg_bv == bv_null_arg)
1903 continue;
1904 bvector_type* bv = this->get_create_slice(unsigned(j));
1905 bv->copy_range(*arg_bv, left, right);
1906 }
1907 } // for j
1908
1909}
1910
1911//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1912
1913template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1914typename base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::unsigned_value_type
1915base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::s2u(value_type v) BMNOEXCEPT
1916{
1917 if constexpr (is_signed())
1918 {
1919 if (v < 0)
1920 {
1921 // the +1 trick is to get abs of INT_MIN without overflowing
1922 // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22268815/absolute-value-of-int-min
1923 value_type uv = -(v+1);
1924 return 1u | unsigned_value_type((unsigned_value_type(uv) << 1u));
1925 }
1926 return unsigned_value_type(unsigned_value_type(v) << 1u);
1927 }
1928 else
1929 return v;
1930}
1931
1932//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1933
1934template<class Val, class BV, unsigned MAX_SIZE>
1935typename base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::value_type
1936base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, MAX_SIZE>::u2s(unsigned_value_type uv) BMNOEXCEPT
1937{
1938 if constexpr (is_signed())
1939 {
1940 if (uv & 1u) // signed
1941 {
1942 value_type s = (-(uv >> 1u)) - 1;
1943 return s;
1944 }
1945 return value_type(uv >> 1u);
1946 }
1947 else
1948 return uv;
1949}
